channel.title: Usagi Electric
channel.description:
Welcome to Usagi Electric!
On this channel, we dive into old school technology, focusing heavily on vacuum tubes. My primary goal is to build computing circuits based off the legendary machines of yesteryear, only with a slight modern twist. All the tubes will be operating with very low voltages on the plate, making the projects safe and easy to follow along with. So, lets grab our multimeters, some random tubes and a low voltage power supply and have fun!
Usagi Electric covers one of my main passions, while my other main passion can be found over on Usagi Motors.

item.title: I Failed to Get Any of These Working on My PDP-11
item.description:
The PDP-11 supercomputer was originally intended to be used with the Fujitsu Eagle, but ultimately, that’s not going to work out because the Eagle is a bit too new, both for me and for the PDP-11. The Eagle is a modified SMD drive, which makes it too fast for the UNIBUS and requires a highly specialized controller card, which I don’t have. So, today, we try to get some other, smaller hard drives working on the 11/44, and we fail spectacularly. It’s all about the journey and not the destination, right? Right?
If you want to support the channel please hop over to Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/usagielectric
Also, we now have some epic shirts for sale! https://my-store-11554688.creator-spring.com
Come join us on Discord! Discord: https://discord.gg/p7UsfHD
Intro Music adapted from: Artist: The Runaway Five Title: The Shinra Shuffle https://ocremix.org/remix/OCR01847
Thanks for watching!
Chapters 0:00 Unfortunate news regarding the Eagle 1:19 What are we trying to achieve here? 3:13 We still need storage 4:12 Will the RA70s come back to life? (No.) 9:41 Will this RA72 come back to life? (No.) 11:32 Will this RZ56 come back to life? (I don’t know man…) 12:17 Everything is just broken today 17:23 Sitrep 18:48 Backplane swap was not on my bingo card 24:46 So… what are we gonna do about storage? 25:31 Priam to the rescue! 28:50 Kitties!

item.title: The Last UE1 Episode!
item.description:
It’s the end of an era. This is the final UE1 episode. But, don’t worry, plenty is still broken, so let’s get to work hammering out all the little problems to get this thing up to 100% functional!
Seriously though, thank you all so much for tagging along with me on this wild journey.
If you want to play with the emulator, the source code is here: https://github.com/Nakazoto/UEVTC/tree/main/UE1/Software/Emulator There are some assembly programs here: https://github.com/Nakazoto/UEVTC/tree/main/UE1/Software/Programs
If you want to support the channel please hop over to Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/usagielectric
Also, we now have some epic shirts for sale! https://my-store-11554688.creator-spring.com
Come join us on Discord!
Discord: https://discord.gg/p7UsfHD
Intro Music adapted from: Artist: The Runaway Five Title: The Shinra Shuffle https://ocremix.org/remix/OCR01847
Thanks for watching!
Chapters 0:00 Fibonacci works perfectly now! 0:55 But how? 3:29 How about that bell though? 6:44 Time to test the input switches and conditional branching 9:03 The worst calculator ever 11:41 Let’s test it on the emulator first 14:55 Will it work? 15:52 No. 19:50 Let’s try that again 20:54 The end… 22:17 Which means more homebrews! 23:07 This was the bunny video used on episode 1 of this series

item.title: Rescuing a Rare version of BASIC with the Data General Nova!
item.description:
It’s time to get the TechTran 8410 tape drive fully up and working, so we can plug it into the Data General Nova 1210 and rescue some ultra rare software, notably BURP, which stands for BASIC language User Responsive Program. A top-tier backronym if I’ve ever seen one!
Come join us at VCF SoCal, East and SouthWest: https://www.vcfsw.org/
If you want to support the channel please hop over to Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/usagielectric
Also, we now have some epic shirts for sale! https://my-store-11554688.creator-spring.com
Come join us on Discord: Discord: https://discord.gg/p7UsfHD
Intro Music adapted from: Artist: The Runaway Five Title: The Shinra Shuffle https://ocremix.org/remix/OCR01847
Thanks for watching!
Chapters 0:00 One of the rarest flavors of BASIC out there 1:16 A real deal, proper 2-track mag tape drive on the bench! 4:38 Let the troubleshooting begin 8:07 It’s cabling, it’s always cabling… 11:00 Rescue mode initiated! 12:47 Job done! It wasn’t easy though… (CM) 15:43 Baud rate issues 17:07 Running BURP! 22:47 Come use BURP in person at VCFSW! 24:36 Rawr! I’m a vicious predator!
